oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Church of the Lord Jesus Christ service, 1997 February 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Hood, Ralph W.; Williamson, W. Paul (William Paul)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Video recording of a service opened by Carl Porter's son and experienced by students from Dalton State College in Dalton, Georgia. The students are accompanied by Professor of Sociology Don Davis. The congregation sings, which is followed by handling by several women in congregation. The handling is followed by testimony from Carl Porter and preaching by Bill Pelfrey.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Appalachian Region, Southern -- Religious life and customs; Pentecostal preaching; Snake cults (Holiness churches) -- Appalachian Region, Southern; Witness bearing (Christianity)
Pelfry, Bill; Porter, Carl
Church of the Lord Jesus Christ (Kingston, Ga.)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:source: Church of the Lord Jesus Christ recordings and photographs
Ralph W. Hood and W. Paul Williamson field recordings, interviews, and photographs
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:isPartOf: Ralph W. Hood and W. Paul Williamson Holiness Churches of Appalachia recordings and interviews
